Fields.DialogueText: Hermes, can you come over here for a second?
What do you need, Captain? Is there something I can do for you?
I've gotten reports of... well, Shakespeare readings in the middle of the night. It's keeping some of the crew up. Do you know anything about this?
I'm sorry, Captain. I didn't think he was being that loud.
Who, exactly?
I'd... rather not say. I wouldn't want anyone getting in trouble. I'll make sure he keeps it down when we're running lines.

Fields.MenuText: Or do it during the day.
Running lines for what, exactly?
I don't care what you do. I just don't want to get any more complaints.

Fields.DialogueText: He's too shy for that. That's another thing we're working on.
There's some sort of play going up on another ship in the fleet. He's hoping to audition. If he can work up the courage.
You won't. I swear on my wings that no one will hear a peep from us.
*ALARM*
Sounds like Morganas. I wonder if they were drawn by the sounds of bad acting.
Actually, he's quite good. Just as long as no one is watching him.
@BATTLE
That's our destination, right, Captain?
It should be. We'll drop off the messages we have and pick up the new ones before heading east.
Are you all right, Captain? With being a messenger at times, I mean.
Of course, it's an important job.
You just sound... bored, maybe?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe a little. It's not the most exciting job in the war.
It's not boredom. You certainly provide enough entertainment.
How can anyone be bored sailing in Morgana-infested waters?

Fields.DialogueText: No, I suppose it isn't. But it's necessary, and... well, I enjoy it.
Heh, well, I try my best. You know, this reminds me of a time during the Great War when...
I don't know. That's why I was asking.
Captain, we've got Morganas heading toward the port.
Will they get there before us?
It's unclear. Their speed seems to be fluctuating. They don't seem to have a specific destination or target in mind yet.
Either way, we should hurry to cut them off. It wouldn't do any good to deliver our messages to a port town in ruins.
@BATTLE
Here you go. These are all the letters we have for you. Careful, we wouldn't want you dropping them. It's a lot.
Yeah, it certainly is. I'll make sure these get where they need to go. Thank you, ma'am.
Now, do you have any for us?
Just the one, actually. You're headed east, correct?
China is our final destination.
But we can make stops on the way if that's what you're wondering.
No, actually, China is perfect. Here.

Fields.MenuText: Anything important?
We'll make sure it gets there as soon as possible.
You're sure this is it?

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, don't pry! Letters are in envelopes for a reason.
You can count on us. We can take anything the sea throws at us.
Any other messages would be more than welcome.
Captain, Hermes, we've got more Morganas approaching.
Well, I guess we don't have time to restock.
Maybe if we had finished them all off before.
I'll leave the fighting to you. Good luck.
Thank you, though I doubt we'll need it.
@BATTLE
Yes, if it's all the same to you, I'd prefer to keep my mouth shut on the matter.
If I had any others to give you, I would. Sorry I don't have more.
Just be careful. Morganas are fearsome beasts.
What's going on down here? Is this supposed to be smoking so much?
Captain, what are you doing down here?!
I heard something from my office. It sounded like an explosion.
Oh, it was nothing, Captain. Don't worry about it. I've got it under control.

Fields.MenuText: Hermes, what are you hiding?
I'm not in the habit of ignoring explosions.
Okay, I'll leave, ignoring all the smoke and the worried faces of the crew.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm... not hiding anything...
It wasn't an explosion, Captain. It was just a loud combustion.
They're not worried, they're... okay, they're worried.
Mhmmmm.
Okay, one of our engines might've had a teeny tiny little accident.
Was this accident explosive?
It was more of a fire...
Can we fix it?
Ummm... no one on board really knows... how...
This is what we get for testing that experimental design.
It works great, though!
As long as we don't mind a little fire.
*ALARM*
Great. Just what this situation was missing.
We'll make sure the engine is patched up for the battle, okay?
Make it quick, not pretty. We'll figure out what to do with it after the battle.
@BATTLE
We need to make for port immediately.
I agree.
Good... but I'm sensing a but.
But I don't want to get rid of that one engine.
Why not? It's prone to catching on fire. We're clearly better off with a standard issue one.
If we trade it out now, it'll never be properly tested. I think it's helpful. We're a lot faster with it.

Fields.MenuText: We're also a lot more flammable.
Speed is important since we're traveling all over the place.
You really think it's making that much of a difference?

Fields.DialogueText: It's not always on fire. If we get it repaired, it should be fine.
Exactly. Just a few days off a voyage could mean the difference between life and death.
I do. I have a connection with the ship. I can feel it.
Look, I'm fine with switching it out after the test run is complete, okay? Let's just make it to China before we get rid of it.
*sigh* Okay, fine. We'll get it repaired, not replaced.
Thanks, Captain.
Now go and keep an eye out for Morganas. I don't want them ambushing us while our engine's on the fritz.
About that, Captain...
@BATTLE
What do you think?
This is... an unusual thing here.
I mean, you say it's a ship's engine, but look at the size of it! I've never seen anything like it.

Fields.MenuText: You wouldn't have. It's still experimental.
Does that mean you can't fix it?
Oh, please, no need to flatter me. It's nothing special.

Fields.DialogueText: Experimental, huh? Yeah, I guess that makes sense.
No, of course I can fix it. It just might cost a little more.
Hmmm... at the very least it's different.
It'll probably take me some time to fix it. Replacing it would be a lot faster.
No, no replacement. We have a little time to spare.
Do we?
With the engine fixed we should be able to make up any lost time.
If you say so.
If you need any assistance, I can be at your disposal.
I just might. You could give me a tour of the engine. It'll speed up my process.
Sure, I have some time now.
I'll leave you two to it. I'll go check on our resupply.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Seven Faced Liar.
Seven Faced Liar, check.
Now the Famous Opera Star.
Famous Opera... Star. It's this one... maybe?
You got it... now I need the... Closed Tourniquet.
Oh, that's this, right?
Ugh, nope, that's the Nasty Car Belt. I'm looking for this guy right here.
Nasty Car Belt... right.

Fields.MenuText: Working hard, or hardly working?
Those... don't sound like mechanical terms.
What did I just walk into?

Fields.DialogueText: We're working very hard, Captain. In fact, we might be done soon.
They are... I think.
You just happened upon our engine being about halfway fixed.
How much longer?
If you want it in tip-top condition? A little while.
Is it good enough for us to handle a small patrol? We're picking up Morganas nearby.
You can do what you want, so I can take a break. Oh, but it might blow up.
*ALARM*
I guess you're taking a break.
It's not actually going to blow up, is it?
It could. But even if it did, I could still fix it.
@BATTLE
I've got my own terms for all my tools. It's part of my process.
All right, just hand me the Cat With Dog Paws and that should be that.
Cat With Dog Paws? You mean this?
Nice guess.
Soooo?
Just give me a second, girl... ah hah! There it is! Can you hear that purr? Music to the ears.
That sounds like a working engine to me.
Captain, we fixed it!
It should be good as new now. No more explosions.

Fields.MenuText: And if there are, do we get our money back?
I hope you're right. Another explosion is the last thing we need in the middle of a fight.
Good to hear. We've wasted enough time. We've got to get back to sea.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, is that all you care about?
We could always load it onto a bomber and drop it on Morganas.
You're right. At this rate we'll have to run at double time.
Okay, I'm out of here. If it starts acting up again, I'm sure you picked up enough to know what to do, right?
I hope so.
Good enough. Now get going. You've got places to go and stuff to shoot.
He's not wrong. We'll be in the thick of it before you know it.
@BATTLE
Tsk, that's not how that works, Cap.
Just don't overwork the engine this time.
I'll keep an eye on it.
*ALARM*
I don't see anything! Where are they?
They must be under us. Maybe the Morganas brought a few submarines with them this time.

Fields.MenuText: Great. I guess Morganas are smarter than I gave them credit for.
Submarines? Like that'll stop us.
No need to send out our bombers, then.

Fields.DialogueText: If they were truly intelligent, then they'd know better than to pick a fight they can't win.
I'm glad to see we can agree here.
No, but we have other means of defending ourselves.
Our bombers might be useless, but we've still got our guns.
Wait, didn't we pick up something else with our experimental engine?
Oh, Captain, I'm not sure we need to use that now.
If not now, when?
I think it's best we save that for a rainy day.
Fine, but we've still got these subs to deal with.
Leave them to me!
@BATTLE
Nineteen, twenty, twenty-one, twenty-t...
Hermes, someone's asking for you in my cabin.

Fields.MenuText: Whoa, those are a lot of letters.
Put all those messages away and come deal with him.
Oh, I can see you're busy, though. Want me to send him away?

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, apparently we've got a lot to say.
It might take a little time. I just poured my messenger bags out.
No, I'll be there shortly, I just have to clean all this up.
Are all those for China?
Most of them. Some are for other ships in our fleet. I was just separating them out now.
Good thinking. You've got to make sure everything gets to its intended.
Exactly! I'm the best for a reason.
*BOOM*
More submarines? Or maybe that was a bomb.
Either way, we've got a fight on our hands!
There must be a base somewhere nearby.
We can worry about that later. Come on, let's take care of some Morganas.
But the letters!
They're not going anywhere.
@BATTLE
Here she is.
You wanted to see me?
Hermes! You've got to help me!
Oh, ah, get up. There's no need to get on your knees.
Just please, you've got to give me some more advice. I'm losing it!

Fields.MenuText: What exactly are you losing?
More advice? What did you tell him before?
Quick, give him some advice before he bursts into tears.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, he's not losing anything, right?
Nothing special, I mean... not really.
Oh, uh, I... I don't work well under pressure!
Please, tell me what to do! She's angry at me and I don't know why!
Did you say something to her?
No, of course not. I'm always too nervous around her to even open my mouth.
*sigh* That's probably the problem. Talk to her, tell her what you're thinking about. You need to be open with her.
The longer you stay silent... the more odd she'll find you to be.
That's... That's genius. Of course that's it. I'll start right away! Thanks a million, Hermes!
Care to explain?
*sigh* It would take too long. We're about to be...
*ALARM*
... interrupted.
You can tell me after.
@BATTLE
I might be... I might be losing her!
It's thanks to you and what you said that I finally got a glimmer of happiness in my life. Please, you can't let it fade away now!
Captain, enemies heading our way. Again.
Damn Morganas. Where are they coming from?
They're approaching from the north. But last time, they were coming from the east.
We might have to make a detour. On our way to China, then.
You want to find wherever they're coming from, don't you?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, and to make sure they stop coming after us.
No, but I think we have to.
Do you have a better idea?

Fields.DialogueText: I think that's a good plan, just as long as we don't do anything stupid.
I agree. If we continue like this, it'll take us twice as long to reach our destination.
No. You're probably right... I just hope we can handle something like that.
*ALARM*
Sounds like they've reached us.
There are more of them than usual.
That might mean we're close to their base.
*BOOM*
That's something to worry about after the battle.
You're right.
@BATTLE
Well, those are big ones.
That has to be it. They have to be leaders of the Morgana group.
Those carriers? They're huge, but I don't know that that necessarily means they're with the earlier attacks.

Fields.MenuText: Look at the sides. What if those pods are refueling stations?
Maybe not, but it's still a huge Morgana. It's our job to destroy it.
I don't know how Morganas work. Do you? For all we know, they're giving birth to them.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe. They could be bombs, or flotation devices, or any number of things.
I guess, but it seems a little too dangerous.
Birth? That's the last thing I want to imagine Morganas doing.
I get the feeling you don't want to engage these Morganas.
I don't. I'm getting a bad feeling. And I don't want to risk these messages blowing up with our ship.
You're worried about a bunch of letters more than the ship?
You know what I mean, Captain.
Captain, the Morganas have turned toward us. I think they're headed our way.
Well, that decides it. It's no longer a choice. Get in position, everyone!
@BATTLE
There they are. Again.
They're still kicking?!
This isn't looking good. Battle stations!
We're throwing everything we have at it!
Not everything...
You're not suggesting...?

Fields.MenuText: If this isn't a rainy day, then I don't know what is.
It's either use it or die!
I don't want to, but... it might be our only choice.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I mean... I guess you have a point.
We can't die! Not yet.
There are other choices. We could...
Okay, use it now!
I'm glad we're finally in agreement.
Captain, should I go get the experimental bomb?
Yeah, load it up, but wait for our signal.
Yes, Captain.
Ready?
Now!
@BATTLE
That... was quite the weapon...
It was incredible.
Do you remember what color the explosion was?

Fields.MenuText: Wasn't it green?
I was too busy praying to notice.
Does it matter? The Morganas are gone.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, right, green. With... specks of red, right?
Well, I wonder if that made the difference in our survival.
It might matter. I don't know yet.
What are you writing?
Hmmm? Oh, this? These are my notes for the experiments. I'm keeping records for when we report our findings.
That's smart, Hermes. I'm happy to hear it.
It's just necessary. When you're testing these things out, every little detail is important.
You really have a love for testing phases, don't you?
I do. This is where it all starts. These tests breed new technologies. If we weren't testing them, then they'd all just sit in a dusty corner of some warehouse.
I'm sure someone else would test them instead.
That would be even worse. That would mean I was missing out on all the fun.
Heh, I guess I get it. It can be a little fun, can't it?
Captain, I think the earlier explosion might've attracted the attention of more Morganas.
Wonderful, they're starting to surround us.
We'll have to fight our way through. Sound the alarm!
@BATTLE
These messages are really important to you, huh?
They aren't any more important than any of the other messages I've been trusted with.
You could've fooled me.
The job is the important part. The letters and their contents don't really matter. The important part is getting them where they need to go.
Some people might think it's boring, and there are certainly more exciting jobs in this war. But this is my job, and there's no one better.

Fields.MenuText: You have a great outlook, Hermes.
I just can't get over the boring part.
I can believe that. I've rarely seen someone so dedicated to their duty.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks. I try to look on the bright side of things.
That's why we keep the Morganas around - to keep things interesting for you.
Ah, stop it, Captain. You're making me blush.
Oh, I think there's a group of Morganas nearby.
Are they coming our way?
No, but if we want to avoid them, we'd better move fast.
Where's the fun in that?
@BATTLE
Oh, that's why?
Can you think of a better reason?
Hermes?
Hello, Murphy. Can I help you with...?
*bawling* Heeeeeeermeees!

Fields.MenuText: She's not here.
Hermeeeees!
Girl troubles again?

Fields.DialogueText: Where isssssss sheeeeee?
Heeeeerrrrrrrmmmeeeeeeesss!
Yeeeeeesss.
Did I hear my na... oh, no, what happened this time?
She, she, she, she dumped meeee.
She dumped you? You poor, poor man. What happened?
She just said that it was her, not me. What's that supposed to mean?
It means she didn't want to hurt your feelings.
*worse bawling*
Captain, you're not helping.
Sorry, I'll shut up.
Why don't you go cry it all out on deck? It's raining right now, so no one will even be able to tell.
I guess that sounds good right now... yeah... I need a good cry.
*ALARM*
No time to cry. Turn those tears of sadness into tears of anger, man!
To war!
@BATTLE
Hey, Hermes. Take a look.
Is that... it is!
We've finally made it to China. It's gorgeous.

Fields.MenuText: Eh, I've seen better.
It's one of my favorite places to visit. I love the trees.
I prefer the west, myself.

Fields.DialogueText: Then you must've seen the other side of China too.
The trees are gorgeous. I'm a big fan of the rivers.
The west is okay, but I prefer to see the sunrise.
I had no idea you were such a fan of China.
I'm in love with China. If I had my way, I'd never leave.
Maybe after we make our delivery, we can stay awhile.
That would depend on how urgent the messages we receive from China are.
You're right. We don't have much time for vacationing.
I'm just glad we'll be making port in Weihai soon. You're going to love it.
*ALARM*
Morganas?
Someone was a little trigger happy. They're heading for us, but they're still a minute off.
At least we have time to prepare for them.
@BATTLE
You, count these!
Yes, Captain.
These are all of them?
Yes, I double and triple checked.
All right, I'll send these out, and I'll send our scientists to you immediately to pick up the prototypes.
Excellent. I look forward to meeting them.
I count two hundred and forty-three.
Two hundred and forty-three? That's all?
Yes.
Is there a problem?
We were under the impression we would receive two hundred and forty-four letters.
I'm... I'm missing one? I promise I'll find it. It couldn't have gone far. I'll send it with the scientists!

Fields.MenuText: Where're you running off to?
Something wrong?
Hey, careful where you're going.

Fields.DialogueText: I... I don't know. I've got to find something!
Everything is wrong! How did this happen?!
I'm sorry, I'm just in a hurry!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Hermes?
Hermes, what are you doing?
I'm looking. Everywhere. I need to find it. I don't lose letters. I just don't.

Fields.MenuText: You lost a letter?
You need some help?
Where was the last place you saw it?

Fields.DialogueText: No! I don't lose letters! I just... don't know where it is.
No, I can handle this, just... ugh. I don't know.
I always keep them in my messenger bags. The only time I take them out is to count them.
Weren't you counting them in your room? Maybe you left one in there?
No, I've always got my eyes on them in there. Oh, except for that one time!
That's right. I dragged you away during that one attack. An explosion might've knocked one on the floor or something.
It must be in my room. I'd better go grab it before the scientists get here.
*ALARM*
Hermes, wait a second. We've got Morganas inbound.
I'll be quick. Just make sure we get far from port before we engage them!
I know already. Hurry back!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
The engine looks... different...
Ah. Yes.
We had to repair it a little.

Fields.MenuText: It had an overheating problem.
It blew up.
It was nothing serious.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, we were aware it might have some heating issues.
It exploded? Hmmm, yet you continued to use it? Interesting.
No, I suspect no. If it was, you'd have uninstalled it.
Hmmm, your repairs might've improved the design. We'll have to research this more.
Well, that would be fortuitous. I hope we've helped, then.
I was told you'd have a letter for us?
Yes, here! It was in my other bag.
Hmmm, I see.
I was told you'd have something for us to deliver back west.
Yes. It might take some time to install, though. We'll take care of it when we exchange your engine.
All right, that sounds good.
If you could give us some space, we need some time to take notes.
Oh, speaking of, these are my notes I took on the engine while we tested it out. They might come in handy.
They may. Thank you.
My pleasure. Good luck.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Is *sniffle* is Hermes here?
No. Is this about your breakup again?
... Yeah...

Fields.MenuText: Heeeeeermeeees!
Maybe I can help you out.
Isn't it about time you got over this already?

Fields.DialogueText: Heeeeeerrrrrrmeeeees!
Do you have a lot of experience with this?
Hey, are you trying to say something about me?
Did somebody call my name?
Yeah, I did.
Oh, is something wrong again?
Actually, I just wanted to say thanks. I think I'm finally done crying.
That's great. I'm glad.
I'm happy I went through all this, but I think I'll keep out of the dating game for a while.
That might be for the best.
Anyway, I'll be leaving now. I just wanted you to know how thankful I was.
Any time.
You collect a lot of strays like him?
Not usually.
Well, now that that episode of Heartbreaks and Heroics is over, let's go on a quick patrol.
*ALARM*
I'm going to do us both a favour and pretend you didn't say that.
This time.
I have enough experience to help you out.
@BATTLE
Here are all the messages we need you to deliver. Sorry there are so many.
I've seen more. I can handle it.
So what are these crates your men are loading onto the ship?
It's an experimental fuel we've been working on. Hopefully our allies will be able to work out some of the kinks we've had.

Fields.MenuText: New fuel? Great. It looks like enough to keep us going for a while.
Kinks? Like what?
That's it? I was hoping for something a little more fun.

Fields.DialogueText: By our estimates, it should get you around the world and back.
It's... quite poisonous, heavier than it should be, and it tends to freeze even at warm temperatures.
Fun? Like jump ropes or sparklers? Sorry, no such luck.
We'll keep records and make sure what we don't use is delivered to our scientists.
Thank you.
How many crates are we getting?
That should be the last of it.
That's good, because there are Morganas nearby. I think they're heading to Weihai.
You're useful. I wish I could do that.
Have your men secure all the fuel and get off as fast as you can.
We'll move at double time, Captain.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Hello, Captain. How goes the paperwork?
It goes away, at the moment. I'm in a good mood.
Brilliant. So... what do you think?

Fields.MenuText: Of Weihai?
Of you?
Of chocolate pudding? I think it's a great dessert. A little overrated, though.

Fields.DialogueText: It's gorgeous, isn't it?
What? Um, I'm not sure what to say... I was asking about Weihai.
Someone's hungry. I was talking about Weihai. We can discuss dessert preferences later.
Weihai is great. It seems like it'd be a great place to vacation.
I'd love to spend my summers here. Maybe winter in Hong Kong. Though Weihai is so beautiful in the snow...
Maybe we can see Hong Kong next time we stop by.
That'd be nice, but we need to return to the UK first.
Back and forth. That's the job.
Hopefully with this fuel, it won't take as long.
We also lost our experimental engine. So...
*ALARM*
I guess the Morganas want us to hurry up, too.
The only thing Morganas want is to destroy us.
Then let's disappoint them.
@BATTLE
Okay, let's take a look at this new fuel.
I'm excited. Aren't you excited? I wonder what it'll do to the ship.
I just hope it doesn't blow us up.
Um, Captain, there's an issue.
What is it?
The... new fuel is... chunky.
Dammit, I specifically asked for creamy.
Chunky? Did it start to freeze? Is it just how it's designed? Oh, it's so exhilarating, isn't it?
You are way too excited to blow us up.

Fields.MenuText: But I'll admit that I'm looking forward to more of you. I mean, uh, working on more of these tests with you...
We are not putting that in our ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Then let's not waste any more time. Let's load up!
Oh, come on, why not?
Yes, ma'am!
Unlike you, I don't trust these experiments as far as I can throw them.
I guess I'll just close this crate, then.
